sentence.Network_en: The Strand is one of London's busiest and most affluent streets.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯特兰德街是伦敦最繁华、最富足的街道之一。

sentence.Network_en: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentence.Network_cn: 几十年来富人们的饮食习惯并未发生太大的变化。

list.abs: conversely , Finch believes that people in affluent countries now live so long because their childhoods are free from diseases like measles , typhoid , malaria , whooping cough , and worms .反过来，芬奇认为现在富裕国家的人们如此长寿，是因为他们的童年没有经历麻疹、伤寒症、疟疾、百日咳和寄生虫病等疾病。

...新庄分行今(12)日开幕，推出「睿智理财」服务，为新富族群(emerging affluent)提供贴近个人生活方式的产品与服务。
时美国经济不但没有危机，而且持续增长，进入"丰裕社会（affluent society）"。惟其经济繁荣富足，贫困的存在就愈形突出和不可容 …
...汽车、电视机、洗衣机、电冰箱等在英国已经是很普遍的现象了。因此英国社会便被认为是一个奢侈品供应丰富、消费兴旺的富足社会(affluent society).自此以后，affluent也一跃为英语常用词。affluent始见于18世纪中期，它源自拉丁语af.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in sense 2): via Old French from Latin affluent- 'flowing towards, flowing freely', from the verb affluere, from ad- 'to' + fluere 'to flow'

entry.def: If you are affluent, you have a lot of money.

example.ex: Cigarette smoking used to be commoner among affluent people.
example.tran: 吸烟曾经在富人中间更为普遍。

means.word_mean: 1. an affluent person; a person who is financially well off;
2. a branch that flows into the main stream
1. having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value;

auth_sentence.content: I'm one of the new affluent workers apparently.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm one of the new affluent workers apparently.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm one of the new affluent workers apparently.

auth_sentence.content: Democrats have made substantial inroads among affluent upper-middle-class voters.
auth_sentence.res_content: Democrats have made substantial inroads among affluent upper-middle-class voters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Democrats have made substantial inroads among affluent upper-middle-class voters.

auth_sentence.content: The city, however, is not an affluent place.
auth_sentence.res_content: The city, however, is not an affluent place.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The city, however, is not an affluent place.

jushi.english: They both come from relatively affluent backgrounds.
jushi.chinese: 他们两人都来自比较富裕的家庭。

jushi.english: They have a relatively affluent way of life.
jushi.chinese: 他们过着一种相对富裕的生活。

jushi.english: In the centre is an affluent fountain of the clearest water.
jushi.chinese: 中央是个喷泉,清澈无比的泉水喷涌而出。
